text: For the British singer see Mollie King Advertisement for Women Men Forget (1920) Advertisement for Greater Than Love (1919 film) (1919) Mollie King ( April 16, 1895 - December 28, 1981) was an American stage and screen actress. == Biography == King began her career on stage, appearing in productions at the Winter Garden in New York from the age of 16. She also starred in Broadway musicals. She signed with Pathé before moving into film acting. She was cast in leading roles in two John M. Stahl directed films, and also starred in serials. George Irving directed her in the film Her Majesty. She later returned to the stage, appearing with her brother Charles King in a musical comedy Good Morning, Judge. === Personal life === King's siblings Charles King and Nellie King were also actors. The Wisconsin Historical Society has a studio portrait of her holding her son in 1920. King married Kentucky distiller Kenneth D. Alexander. She married a second time to Thomas Claffey. She died in Fort Lauderdale, Florida and was buried in Woodlawn Cemetery in The Bronx, New York. ==Theater== *Good Morning, Judge *Blue Eyes ==Filmography== * (1916) *A Circus Romance (1916) * (1916) * (1916) *The Summer Girl (1916) * (1916) *The Mystery of the Double Cross (1917) *The Seven Pearls (1917) *Kick In (1917) * Blind Man's Luck (1917) *The On-the-Square Girl (1917) * (1917) * (1920) *Suspicious Wives (1921) *Her Majesty (1922) *Pied Piper Malone (1924) ==References== Category:1898 births Category:1981 deaths Category:American silent film actresses Category:American stage actors Category:Burials at Woodlawn Cemetery (Bronx) Category:20th-century American actresses Category:Broadway actors Category:American musical theatre actresses
title: Mollie King (actress)
